bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, May 17, 1923

div1.p: Read writes that the Colombian government is cooperating with Miller. Read also mentions financial issues surrounding the work in South America. Work is under way to gain entry to Venezuela in order to make a survey of the situation there.

May 17, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We have received another cable from Doctor
Miller in Colombia which reads as follows:

“J. H. White delayed Expected to arrive on the
15th prox. Yellow fever accepted by govern-
ment It will be necessary to investigate
Cucuta probable source and Barranquilla
Pothier and Pareja will investigate and let
you know the result Will be finished on or
about July 1, 1923 Stop Government will
assume one-half expenses Stop Estimate
cost Board $50,000 June to January
If satisfactory credit account of F. A. Miller
with $10,000 Try to secure invitation
Venezuela at once Cable F. A. Miller who
will send on J. H. White.”

The Venezuelan situation is having attention,
and we hope to receive an invitation to make a survey of
conditions there.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
